title: Geometric series
definition: Geometric series are sums of terms of the form \(z_n=a r^n\) with \(a,r\) constants.
sum:
Define \(S_n=\sum\limits_{k=0}^{n}a r^k\).
Multiplying by \(a\) and using the distributive law: \[r S_n=\sum\limits_{k=0}^{n}a r^{k+1}\]
We notice that this series includes all the terms of \(S_n\) except for the \(k=0\) term, \(r\). We also have an extra term, \(a r^{n+1}\): \[r S_n=S_n +a r^{n+1} -a\]
Solving and simplifying: \[S_n=a \frac{r^{n+1} -1}{r-1} \]
